statement.p: Graph the equation \displaystyle{y}={2}{\left({5}^{{{x}+{2}}}\right)}+{2}. You will select a point on the asymptote (only y coordinate matters); then you select two points on the exponential.

solution.p: Because \displaystyle{y}={2}{\left({5}^{{{x}+{2}}}\right)}+{2} has \displaystyle+{2} at the end, the asymptote is at \displaystyle{y}={2}.
One convenient point is where \displaystyle{x}+{2}={0} which is \displaystyle{x}=-{2}. Here \displaystyle{y}={4}.
A second convenient point is one right of -2, which is \displaystyle{x}=-{1}. Here \displaystyle{y}={12}
